ygData.subject: RE: Area Songs in Lguk [WAS:Does CHR affect Largos?
ygData.msgSnippet: I didn t mean this tactic for shadowmen.  For those I use the bard s gate (funny my equipment never seems to follow me on those).  I was talking about other
ygData.messageBody:
I didn't mean this tactic for shadowmen. For those I
use the bard's gate (funny my equipment never seems to
follow me on those). I was talking about other fast
mobs that would be blue, yet still deadly. The
Highland Lions and the Griffawns of NK come to mind.

Tomerrilin

--- Lonnie Lewis <LLewis@...> wrote:
> Problem is that if you don't have screech, shadow
> men are going to be pretty
> red to you (I think), so lullaby simply won't work
> at all for you.
>
> Bien
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Peck White [SMTP:peck_white@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, February 10, 2000 11:55 AM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Area Songs in Lguk
> [WAS:Does CHR affect
> > Largos?
> >
> > From: Peck White <peck_white@...>
> >
> > For the lower levels, like me, couldn't you get
> the
> > same effect twisting Selo's and Lullaby? One
> > successful nod and you've got yourself enough of a
> > head start to make it to the zone.
> >
> > Tomerrilin
> >
> > --- Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...> wrote:
> > >
> > > That reminds me, always keep screech mem'd ;-)
> > >
> > > [connecting to shadowmen thread] This is how a
> > > bard can outrun
> > > shadowmen. Selo's + Screech. The shadowmen
> move
> > > so fast in the
> > > opposite direction that they are out of agro
> > > radius within about
> > > 2 seconds and give up the chase. So if
> someone
> > > asks you if you
> > > can outrun shadowmen, you can if you are
> creative.
> > > Just twist
> > > Selos and Screech and take off.
> > >
> > > Harmonic.
> > >
> > >
